text: The Nordstrom building in downtown Portland, Oregon occupies a city block next to Pioneer Courthouse Square and houses a Nordstrom store. ==Description and history== The building was completed in 1977. According to The Oregonian, the building's construction "helped kickstart a much-needed retail revitalization". In 2001, Parr Financial purchased the building from Portland CT Investment Inc. for $13.1 million plus $200,000 in other costs.https://www.bizjournals.com/portland/stories/2001/08/27/daily22.html Garth Edwards' 1990 brushed stainless steel sculpture Urban Arrangements is attached to the east and west sides of the building.https://racc.org/wp- content/uploads/2016/01/ArtWalk_2014.pdf The artwork depicts abstract trees and branches, measures approximately 10 ft. x 15 ft. x 1/2 in., and was surveyed by the Smithsonian Institution's "Save Outdoor Sculpture!" program in 1993. title: Nordstrom (Portland, Oregon)
